ÃÂ¢Ãâ¬ÃÅUsing Loopholes to Reveal the Marginal Cost of Regulation: The Case of Fuel-Economy Standards.ÃÂ¢Ãâ¬ÃÂ The American Economic Review 101 (4):1375ÃÂ¢Ãâ¬Ãâ1409. driving related external costs across all model years in one calendar year compared summing driving related external costs across calendar years for one model of vehicle, the compliance costs occur only in the year of production and will be the same under both cost calculations.

For example, Anderson and Sallee (2011) estimate an upper bound of compliance costs of $55 per vehicle. Estimates in Jacobsen (2013a) range from $52 to $438 per vehicle depending on the vehicle fleet. At $55 per vehicle and an illustrative 15 million vehicles sold, the compliance costs are less than $1 billion. At $200 per vehicle, the compliance cots are $3 billion.
